DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation And/Or Cellular Therapy Recipient Research Data Shared Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the hematopoietic cell transplant and/or cellular therapy recipient consented for sharing research data.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation And/Or Cellular Therapy Recipient Research Data Shared Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy._A person who gets something._Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered._A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn._Have in common; held or experienced in common._Permission to do something.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation And/Or Cellular Therapy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

Property.preferredName: Recipient Research Activity Data Shared Consent
Property.preferredDefinition: A person who gets something.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:Have in common; held or experienced in common.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.
A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
Have in common; held or experienced in common.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
